intro: Haploseseli, commonly known as the "dwarf sunflower," is a small herbaceous plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Haploseseli is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Its compact size and drought tolerance make it a resilient species in its native habitat.
